monogr.title: A sea grammar : vvith the plaine exposition of Smiths Accidence for young sea-men, enlarged. Diuided into fifteene chapters: what they are you may partly conceiue by the contents. Written by Captaine Iohn Smith, sometimes gouernour of Virginia, and admirall of Nevv-England
monogr.author: Smith, John

keywords.term: Dictionaries, vocabularies, phrase books, instruction in foreign languages

div.head: To the much deseruing Captaine, Iohn Smith.
div.l: I Hate to flatter thee, but in my heart
I honour thy faire worth and high desert;
And thus much I must say, thy merits claime
Much praise & honor, both from Truth & Fame.
What Iudge so • 're thy Actions ouer-looke,
Thou need'st not feare a triall by thy Booke.
